content.title: Guru Shishya Parampara
content.beneficiary: Eminent Practitioners and young talents in the field of art
content.details: The government of India, Ministry of Culture runs a scheme called 'Guru Shishya Parampara Scheme' through Zonal Cultural Centres to preserve and promote rare and vanishing art forms on Classical or Folk/Tribal so that the young talents be nurtured to acquire skills in their chosen field of art under the able guidance of Gurus. The scheme was introduced in 2003-04.
benefits: To preserve and promote rare and vanishing art forms on Classical or Folk/Tribal.
Financial assistance for Gurus, Accompanists, and Shishyas.
eligibility: The applicants should be Indian citizens.
Applicants (Guru) should be Eminent Practitioners/ Resourceful persons in the specified field.
Applicants (Guru) should be between 45 to 70 years.
Applicants (Guru) should be physically and mentally sound to run efficiently the Guru Shishya Parampara Kendra.
The Shishyas should be in the age groups of 15 to 25 years.
documents_required: VCD/DVD/CD/Photograph must be furnished along with the application form.

faqs.question: What is the scope of this scheme?
faqs.answer: A scheme called 'Guru Shishya Parampara Scheme' to preserve and promote rare and vanishing art forms on Classical or Folk/Tribal so that the young talents be nurtured to acquire skills in their chosen field of art under the able guidance of Gurus.

faqs.question: What are the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Selected Guru Accompanist and four Shishyas will be appointed for a period of one year. For Gurus: Rs. 7,500/-; For Accompanist (one): Rs. 3,750/-; For Shishyas (Four): Rs. 1,500/- (each).

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All applicants who are citizens of India and come under the age group between 45 to 70 will be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any eligibility percentage of disability?
faqs.answer: No, there are no such criteria.
